duties_responsibilities.duty: Engage clients in the lobby to educate and assist with conducting transactions through self-service resources such as mobile banking, online banking, or ATM.
Accurately and efficiently process cash transactions for clients as needed.
Have deep conversations with clients to gain in-depth knowledge of their financial and life priorities.
Build relationships with individual clients to meet their financial needs.
Follow established processes and guidelines in daily activities to do what is right for clients and the bank, adhering to all applicable laws and regulations.
Manage financial center traffic, appointments, and outbound calls effectively.
Identify solutions for new and existing clients based on their needs.
Educate clients on how to conduct simple banking transactions through self-service technologies (e.g., ATM, online banking, mobile banking).
Apply strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to meet clients’ needs.
Follow established processes and guidelines in daily activities to do what is right for clients and the bank, adhering to all applicable laws and regulations.
Focus on results, while acting in the best interest of the client.
Be flexible to work weekends and/or extended hours as needed.
Grow business knowledge and network by partnering with experts in small business, lending, and investments.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or business relevant associate degree (e.g., business management, business administration, finance)
